bugs.title: CVE-2023-6112 chromium: chromium-browser: Use after free in Navigation [epel-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2023-6112 chromium: chromium-browser: Use after free in Navigation [epel-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2023-6112 chromium-browser: Use after free in Navigation

long_desc.thetext:
Use after free in Navigation in Google Chrome prior to 119.0.6045.159 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2023/11/stable-channel-update-for-desktop_14.html
https://crbug.com/1499298
https://www.debian.org/security/2023/dsa-5556

Created chromium tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 2250776]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 2250775]

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

http://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2250773

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# low, medium, high, urgent (required)
severity=high

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=2250773,2250776

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi web interface to submit updates:

https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/new
FEDORA-EPEL-2023-7e5dc8aef7 has been submitted as an update to Fedora EPEL 7. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2023-7e5dc8aef7

FEDORA-EPEL-2023-7e5dc8aef7 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 7 stable repository.
If problem still persists, please make note of it in this bug report.

comments.text: This update has been submitted for testing by than.
This update's test gating status has been changed to 'ignored'.
This update has been pushed to testing.
NAK, conflicts with ffmpeg-libs from rpmfusion
Bodhi is disabling automatic push to stable due to negative karma. The maintainer may push manually if they determine that the issue is not severe.

i am not sure if you have tested it before you granted the negative karma. The chromium build for epel7/8 does not link against system ffmpeg but rather the bundle ffmpeg and therefore is not effect by abi change in ffmpeg.
This update can be pushed to stable now if the maintainer wishes
This update has been submitted for stable by than.
This update has been pushed to stable.

notes:
update to 119.0.6045.159, upstream security release

- High CVE-2023-5997, use after free in Garbage Collection
- High CVE-2023-6112, use after free in Navigation
